intro: Gonolobus scaber, commonly known as roughleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and trumpet-shaped, violet or blue flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other morning glory species. It typically grows as a climbing vine, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its seeds are dispersed by animals and can remain viable in the soil for several years.
